posts.name: DrewTheRat
posts.cooked:
We have PhotonVision running on an Orange Pi 5 with one AprilTag and one ObjectDetection camera. We have an intermittent issue where the ObjectDetection pipeline doesn’t work on boot.

The code reports the camera isn’t present and there is no data in the network table. When we check the web UI, it shows the yellow spinning image for that pipeline and the camera never comes up. The camera also does not appear on the Camera Settings page.

We do not think this is a power issue, as we have a fully charged battery and we’re powering with the Pololu D36V50F5 that has been recommended by many. Also, restarting the entire device via the settings page almost always resolves the issue. (Restarting takes a long time, BTW, close to 2 minutes).

Has anyone else seen this kind of issue with ObjectDetection pipelines (and cameras) missing on boot? Or does anyone have any diagnostic suggestions?

link_counts.title: Is photon vision just better than LimelightOS?

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked: Following…

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked:
Adding to this thread that we see the same thing as 2495 with a configuration very similar to 1089 as we sourced our knowledge and parts there.

We also can see that weird “Placeholder Camera” thing if we do a Photonvision software reset in the Camera Settings page rather than restarting the entire device on said page:

Another weird thing we observe at 2495, which could be completely unrelated, is that the static IP config settings are not taken into account.

While we ask for static 10.24.95.13, we get 10.24.95.211 (thanks Angry IP Scanner - Download for Windows, Mac or Linux )

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: We see this happen, but often it’s after several frames have processed (so there’s NT data but it’s old)

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked:
Another apparent bug is that if the object detection camera/pipeline is down, then we get the AprilTag camera/pipeline stream mixed up with the object detection camera settings.

Working AprilTag stream/setting: 20240309_182737_720 720×405 24.1 KB

20240309_182737_720 720×405 24.1 KB

20240309_182737_720 720×405 24.1 KB

AprilTag stream somehow showing up in the object detection camera page when it is down: 20240309_182748_720 720×405 26.1 KB

20240309_182748_720 720×405 26.1 KB

20240309_182748_720 720×405 26.1 KB

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked:
Yet another weird issue is that sometimes after a reboot the object detection camera pipeline looks fine in the built-in PhotonVision web server, but is somehow not making its way to the Shuffleboard which remains black:

20240309_185806_720 720×405 19.7 KB

20240309_185806_720 720×405 19.7 KB

20240309_185806_720 720×405 19.7 KB

Note that, while not pictured here, the AprilTag stream is working completely fine on the same tab of the Shuffleboard.

The problem is always on the object detection camera/pipeline/stream side. Never the AprilTag camera/pipeline/stream side.

And sometimes things work perfectly. And we cannot find a pattern.

link_counts.title: Limelight w/ PhotonVision crashing with Network Table errors

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked:
Amicus1:

We see this happen, but often it’s after several frames have processed (so there’s NT data but it’s old)

So what do you do to mitigate the issue?

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: Abandon object detection until after this weekend’s competition.

posts.name: Matt
posts.cooked: The next time this happens, can someone ssh in using username: pi/password: raspberry and run sudo dmesg > /tmp/dmesg_logs.txt and then post this file along with your photonvision logs, and an estimate for when it died? You can grab this file using filezilla/winscp/sftp or similar

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked: Thanks! Bonus question: is there a way to easily perform a factory reset of the device without reflashing the microSD card?

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked:
Looking back, maybe this problem is the root cause of us not being able to use two Lifecams at once?

How to setup PhotonVision for three cameras (AprilTag camera, ObjectDetection camera, and plain remote vision camera) - Technical / PhotonVision - Chief Delphi

posts.name: DrewTheRat
posts.cooked:
gartaud:

Looking back, maybe this problem is the root cause of us not being able to use two Lifecams at once?

We are only using one LifeCam, so that should not be our issue. We will try to get the dmesg output if it happens during testing this week.

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: Scroll down past “manage device networking”- have you selected an interface for photonvision to manage?

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked: Oops we had not. Static IP works now. Thanks!

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked:
Is there a way in the built in UI to see the port number of the streams? Things are working in the built-in UI this morning but it seems that the NT are not getting anything on the object detection side.

I expect a feed on port 1186 but there is nothing on the NT about that. There is a port 1190. But there is nothing there.

How can I check what is really streaming? And check if NT correlate with that?

Funny thing is that the Photonvision APIs do return data this morning. Only the video stream is not published an/or working.

posts.name: Matt
posts.cooked:
If you cna’t see streams, then just opening the image in a new tab won’t work. You can export your settings DB and look at it in a sqlite viewer, or look at the network debug  info in inspect element, or with v2024.2.9 look at the log viewer for the port number in debug-level logs?

image 1498×677 114 KB

posts.name: Matt
posts.cooked:
Potentially uploading a blank zip file to the import settings dialog will do it, no promises though. Otherwise ssh in and sudo rm -rf /opt/photonvision/photonvision_config .

This is a pain point we wanna address this offseason for sure.

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked: And then reboot?

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked: For reference that didn’t help with the object detection camera not working.
